frame.name: Temporal_collocation
frame.definition:
<def-root>A Trajector is identified as occurring at the same time as some better-known Landmark. We consider sequenced calendric units (e.g. Tuesday, 1987, January) as periods for the purposes of this frame. Some lexical items allow certain types of frame elements while disallowing others (e.g. *<t>During</t> Tuesday...).
Several words of this frame (e.g. <ment>now.adv</ment>) have deictic incorporation of the <fen>Landmark_period</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Trajector_event">He tried to take care of that</fex> <t>on</t> <fex name="Landmark_event">his last visit</fex> .</ex> <ex>I especially like <fex name="Trajector_entity">brunch</fex> <t>on</t> <fex name="Landmark_period">Sunday</fex>.</ex> <ex>Dinosaurs lived in <t>prehistoric</t> <fex name="Trajector_period">eras</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Trajector_event">He did it</fex> <t><fex name="Landmark_period">then</fex></t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Trajector_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity that occurs at some time.
<ex>The <t>current</t> <fex name="Trajector_entity">President of Georgia</fex> was born in Tbilisi.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Trajector_entity">Books</fex> <t>in</t> the early 19th century had fewer pictures.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Landmark_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>The event which designates the time at which a trajector occurs.
<ex><t>During</t> <fex name="Landmark_event">last night's walk</fex> , I stubbed my toe.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the state of affairs reported by the target is understood to play a role in the state of affairs of the modifier.</def-root>

FE.name: Trajector_period
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period that occurs with respect to some other time.
<ex><t>Future</t> <fex name="Trajector_period">eras</fex> will be vastly changed from today.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Landmark_period
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period in which a trajector takes place. This period can be cyclical and, in that case, is interpreted contextually.
<ex>I went to the store <t>on</t> <fex name="Landmark_period">Tuesday</fex>.</ex> <ex><t>In</t> <fex name="Landmark_period">the Triassic Era</fex>, the first flying vertebrates appeared.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Trajector_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>The event that occurs at some time.
<ex><t>Currently</t>, <fex name="Trajector_event">researchers are making new discoveries very quickly.</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Landmark_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity which designates the time of some trajector. Note: this FE is infrequent or non-existent in English and is included for completeness.</def-root>
